definitions.definition: To imply but stop short of explicitly stating (something).
examples: Are you suggesting that I killed my wife?

definitions.definition: To cause one to suppose (something); to bring to one's mind the idea (of something).
examples: The name "hamburger" suggests that hamburgers originated from Hamburg.

definitions.definition: To explicitly mention (something) as a possibility for consideration, often to recommend it.
examples: This meeting venue was suggest ed to us by our boss.
He suggests that we celebrate with dinner at Bellissimo. He suggests our celebrating with dinner at Bellissimo.
The guidebook suggested that we visit the local cathedral, so that's what we did.

definitions.definition: To seduce ; to prompt to evil; to tempt .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To imply but stop short of explicitly stating (something).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause one to suppose (something); to bring to one's mind the idea (of something).
( transitive ) To explicitly mention (something) as a possibility for consideration, often to recommend it.
( obsolete , transitive ) To seduce ; to prompt to evil; to tempt .
